articles.headline: A Nuclear Deal Is Likely to Hit Hurdles in Iran
articles.snippet: Whatever deal is reached in Vienna between Secretary of State John Kerry and Iranian negotiators, it may not matter if hard-liners have their way.
articles.abstract: Whatever deal is reached in Vienna between Secretary of State John Kerry and Iranian negotiators, it may not matter if hard-liners have their way.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Far from the flashing cameras and microphones in Vienna, where Secretary of State John Kerry is joining Iranian and United States diplomats in a final push to reach a compromise on Tehran’s nuclear program, a different sort of political drama unfolded in the Iranian capital this week: Hard-liners got together to criticize the objects of their “worries,” as they put it, the moderates advocating a deal.

articles.headline: Argentina’s Case Has No Victors, Many Losers
articles.snippet: With no international debt restructuring mechanism in place, holders of bonds in default are left with rulings by national courts that can be contradictory.
articles.abstract: With no international debt restructuring mechanism in place, holders of bonds in default are left with rulings by national courts that can be contradictory.

articles.headline: Sotheby’s Chief to Step Down; Drew Fire From Loeb
articles.snippet: After the hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb called for sweeping changes, the auction house said the departure of William Ruprecht was “by mutual consent.”
articles.abstract: After the hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb called for sweeping changes, the auction house said the departure of William Ruprecht was “by mutual consent.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The chairman and chief executive of Sotheby’s is stepping down, the auction house said on Thursday, a little more than a year after the billionaire hedge fund manager Daniel S. Loeb derided the company as “an old master painting in desperate need of restoration” and demanded sweeping changes.
articles.byline: By Carol Vogel and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Activists Wield Search Data to Challenge and Change Police Policy
articles.snippet: The use of public data on stop and search is an alternative tactic as communities who say they are unfairly targeted seek to rewrite their relationship with the police.
articles.abstract: The use of public data on stop and search is an alternative tactic as communities who say they are unfairly targeted seek to rewrite their relationship with the police.
articles.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N.C. — One month after a Latino youth died from a gunshot as he sat handcuffed in the back of a police cruiser here last year, 150 demonstrators converged on Police Headquarters, some shouting “murderers” as baton-wielding officers in riot gear fired tear gas.

articles.headline: Falling Wages at Factories Squeeze the Middle Class
articles.snippet: A new study from the National Employment Law Project shows that real wages for manufacturing workers declined three times as much as for workers as a whole.
articles.abstract: A new study from the National Employment Law Project shows that real wages for manufacturing workers declined three times as much as for workers as a whole.
articles.lead_paragraph: For nearly 20 years, Darrell Eberhardt worked in an Ohio factory putting together wheelchairs, earning $18.50 an hour, enough to gain a toehold in the middle class and feel respected at work.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: After Criticism, Fed Will Study Wall St. Oversight
articles.snippet: On the eve of a Senate hearing on bank regulation, the Fed issued a surprise announcement that it would review crucial aspects of its bank supervision.
articles.abstract: On the eve of a Senate hearing on bank regulation, the Fed issued a surprise announcement that it would review crucial aspects of its bank supervision.
articles.lead_paragraph: Under pressure to show that it is up to the task of regulating giant Wall Street firms, the Federal Reserve issued a surprise announcement on Thursday that it would review crucial aspects of its bank supervision.

articles.headline: Eavesdropping on Pakistani Official Led to Inquiry Into Former U.S. Diplomat
articles.snippet: In a conversation intercepted by American investigators, the official suggested that his government was receiving secrets from a prominent former diplomat with the State Department.
articles.abstract: In a conversation intercepted by American investigators, the official suggested that his government was receiving secrets from a prominent former diplomat with the State Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American investigators intercepted a conversation this year in which a Pakistani official suggested that his government was receiving American secrets from a prominent former State Department diplomat, officials said, setting off an espionage investigation that has stunned diplomatic circles here.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo, Michael S. Schmidt and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: In Change of Strategy, China Cuts Interest Rate
articles.snippet: The step suggests that policy makers have become nervous about the pace at which growth is slowing, though analysts said the change’s effect would be small.
articles.abstract: The step suggests that policy makers have become nervous about the pace at which growth is slowing, though analysts said the change’s effect would be small.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China finally admitted it has a growth problem — and that is a big step to getting the global economy back on track.

articles.headline: A Black Friday Campout
articles.snippet: Even in an era of one-click web shopping, people like Derek De Armond are still willing to camp out for weeks to land the best in-store deals.
articles.abstract: Even in an era of one-click web shopping, people like Derek De Armond are still willing to camp out for weeks to land the best in-store deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: By spreading its doorbuster specials over five days this year, Walmart may have thought it was sounding the death knell for the annual shopping frenzy known as Black Friday.
